intro: Mitracarpus fischeri, commonly known as the Fischer's mitracarpus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its unique, umbrella-shaped inflorescence. The plant has compound leaves with a distinctive pinnate structure, and its flowers are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in arid and rocky environments, showcasing adaptations to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
